histogram.name: Windows.ApplockerRunning
histogram.summary: Records if the APPID driver is running which indicates Applocker is enabled and running. This does not guarantee that Applocker is configured to enforce any rules. Reported once per browser session, on startup.

histogram.name: Windows.CetAvailable
histogram.summary: Records if CET (Control-flow Enforcement Technology / Hardware Enforced Shadow Stack) is available, based on IsUserCetAvailableInEnvironment(). Reported once per browser session, on startup.

histogram.name: Windows.CetEnabled
histogram.summary: Records if CET (Control-flow Enforcement Technology / Hardware Enforced Shadow Stack) is enabled or if it has been disabled by IFEO. Reported only if CetAvailable is true, once per browser session, on startup. Note: This was recorded incorrectly in M91.

histogram.name: Windows.ChromeDllPrefetchResult
histogram.summary: The result of prefetching chrome.dll on Windows, including whether a fallback to slow prefetch took place, and why if so.

histogram.name: Windows.ComputeNativeWindowOcclusionTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2020. As of June 15, 2020, data indicates that computing occlusion is fast enough at all percentiles.
histogram.summary: The amount of CPU time a call to ComputeNativeWindowOcclusionStatus() takes.

histogram.name: Windows.FileDeleteLastRetryError
histogram.summary: Last File deletion error in DeleteFileWithRetry when no retry succeeded, because we exceeded the retry count.

histogram.name: Windows.FileDeleteRetryCount
histogram.summary: The number of retries needed to successfully delete a file from GetDeleteFileCallback. 0 means it succeeded the first time, 9 means it never succeeded.

histogram.name: Windows.FilesystemError{FileOperations}
histogram.summary: The Windows error code relating to a failed attempt to operate on a file or a directory. {FileOperations}

variant.obsolete: Base histogram. Use suffixes of this histogram instead.

histogram.name: Windows.GetVersionExVersion
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2020 as this histogram has been replaced by the synthetic histogram Windows.WindowsVersion generated from Windows.PatchLevel.
histogram.summary: The Windows version (base::win::Version) as reported by GetVersionEx(). This is queried shortly after startup.

histogram.name: Windows.HasHighResolutionTimeTicks
histogram.summary: The value of TimeTicks::IsHighResolution(). Reported once per browser session, on startup.

histogram.name: Windows.HighResolutionTimerUsage
histogram.summary: Percentage of elapsed time the high resolution timer is activated. The usage is reported by each of Chrome processes individually (without aggregation) and logged every 10 minutes.

histogram.name: Windows.HypervPresent
histogram.summary: Whether Hyper-V is enabled on this machine. Logged shortly after startup. This metric will only be logged on Windows 10+.

histogram.name: Windows.InspectModule.ConnectionError
histogram.summary: Whether connection error has happened for the UtilWin service. Every time a connection is made to the service, a "false" value is reported to provide a baseline. Every time a mojo connection error happens, a "true" value is reported, which typically means the utility process crashed.

histogram.name: Windows.IsPinnedToTaskbar
histogram.summary: Indicates whether Chrome is pinned to the Windows taskbar for the current user. Recorded shortly after startup.

histogram.name: Windows.IsPinnedToTaskbar.ProcessError
histogram.summary: Indicates whether a connection error occured between the browser and the shell handler process. This is usually caused by a crash in the utility process. This is logged every time the pinned state is queried.

histogram.name: Windows.IsPinnedToTaskbar2
histogram.summary: Indicates whether Chrome is pinned to the Windows taskbar for the current user. Recorded shortly after startup. This is different from Windows.IsPinnedToTaskbar in that we do not check if the pin to taskbar verb is available on the shortcut and only relies on the shortcut existing in the User Pinned folder.

histogram.name: Windows.Kernel32Version
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2020 as this histogram has been replaced by the synthetic histogram Windows.WindowsVersionKernel32 generated from Windows.PatchLevelKernel32.
histogram.summary: The Windows version (base::win::Version) as reported by VerQueryValue() on kernel32.dll. This is queried shortly after startup.

histogram.name: Windows.Menu.Win11Style
histogram.summary: Indicates whether Windows 11 style menus are used. Recorded on menu configuration initialization.

histogram.name: Windows.ModuleInspector.ReadCacheResult
histogram.summary: The result of reading the InspectionResultsCache from disk. The cache is read once at startup when the ModuleInspector needs it.

histogram.name: Windows.ModuleInspector.WriteCacheResult
histogram.summary: The result of writing the InspectionResultsCache to disk. This is done every time the ModuleDatabase becomes idle.

histogram.name: Windows.NativeWindowVisibility{NativeWindowVisibility}

variant.name: .Hidden
variant.summary: The native window is not visible because it is in a minimized window

variant.name: .Occluded
variant.summary: The native window is fully covered by other windows

variant.name: .Visible
variant.summary: The native window is visible or partially visible.

histogram.name: Windows.OOPSelectFileDialog.ProcessError
histogram.summary: Indicates whether a connection error occured between the browser and the shell handler process. This is usually caused by a crash in the utility process. This is logged every time SelectFile() function is called and the WinOOPSelectFileDialog feature is enabled.

histogram.name: Windows.ParentProcessNameHash
histogram.summary: The 32-bit hash of the lower-case parent process basename (e.g. explorer.exe) of the main Chrome executable. Reported once during startup as part of install verification.

histogram.name: Windows.PatchLevel
histogram.summary: A 32-bit value formed from combining the minor and patch level of the currently running Windows operating system as reported by GetVersionEx(). E.g. "Windows 10 OS Version 1809 (Build 17763.503)" would be 17763 (0x4563), combined with 503 (0x1F7) = 0x456301F7. If either minor or patch level exceeds the value that can fit in a 16-bit unsigned integer, then this histogram will report 0. Reported once, shortly after browser startup.

histogram.name: Windows.PatchLevelKernel32
histogram.summary: A 32-bit value formed from combining the minor and patch level of the currently running Windows operating system as reported by VerQueryValue() of kernel32.dll. E.g. "Windows 10 OS Version 1809 (Build 17763.503)" would be 17763 (0x4563), combined with 503 (0x1F7) = 0x456301F7. If either minor or patch level exceeds the value that can fit in a 16-bit unsigned integer, then this histogram will report 0. Reported once, shortly after browser startup.

histogram.name: Windows.PostOperationState{FileOperations}
histogram.summary: The state of an item in the filesystem following an operation on it. {FileOperations}

variant.obsolete: Base histogram. Use suffixes of this histogram instead.

histogram.name: Windows.ProcessorFamily
histogram.summary: The processor family type. Logged shortly after startup. The value is specified in the SMBIOS specification, section 7.5.2: https://www.dmtf.org/sites/default/files/standards/documents/DSP0134_2.7.1.pdf This metric will only be logged on Windows 10+.

histogram.name: Windows.ProcessorVirtualizationFirmwareEnabled
histogram.summary: Whether virtualization has been enabled in the system firmware. Logged shortly after startup. This metric will only be logged on Windows 10+.

histogram.name: Windows.ServiceStatus.SSP
histogram.summary: This records whether any SSP/AD providers are registered on the system. If there are any then this typically means the network sandbox cannot successfully engage. Recorded each time the browser attempts to start the network service process. This metric is only recorded on Windows 10+.

histogram.name: Windows.Tablet
histogram.summary: Count of browser launches from a Windows tablet pc.

histogram.name: Windows.TmpFileDeleter.FailCount
histogram.summary: The number of files failed to be deleted in a single directory by the browser process's tmp file deleter on Windows. These are files that were left behind on previous runs when third-party software interfered with Chrome's ability to delete its own temporary files. No value is emitted for a directory if no delete attempts are made. Otherwise, the fail count will be zero or more.

histogram.name: Windows.TmpFileDeleter.SuccessCount
histogram.summary: The number of files deleted in a single directory by the browser process's tmp file deleter on Windows. These are files that were left behind on previous runs when third-party software interfered with Chrome's ability to delete its own temporary files. No value is emitted for a directory if no delete attempts are made. Otherwise, the success count will be zero or more.

histogram.name: Windows.TouchDrag.Success
histogram.summary: Recorded each time the user starts a Windows touch drag drop of web contents. This is currently only used by the WebUI tab strip, where touch drag drop is enabled, to count the number of touch drags attempted. ::DoDragDrop occasionally blocks waiting for a right mouse button down followed by a move, which is detected by ::DoDragDrop not calling QueryContinueDrag for more than a second. This will be recorded as false. This stat will be used to determine how much of a real world problem this is.

histogram.name: Windows.UnpinShortcut.ProcessError
histogram.summary: Indicates whether a connection error occured between the browser and the shell handler process. This is usually caused by a crash in the utility process. This is logged every time shortcuts are unpinned from the taskbar.
